website_summaries.verdict: If you'd rather buy than rent, this model is one to consider for a beginning student.
pros: Affordable alternative to student violin rentals
Good quality bow and case included
Cremona is a respected name among music instructors
cons: Sound quality is not impressive – dull and flat

customer_reviews.title: We opened the case and immediately saw the bow had ...
customer_reviews.text: We opened the case and immediately saw the bow had strings visibly hanging off of it. When we turned the latch to remove the bow to inspect it, we could see that several strings were caught in the the latch. It took several minutes to carefully extracate it from the latch without breaking even more strings. Not sure if this was previously used and returned as new or just carelessly packed. We haven't tuned it yet and will update our review on the actual violin later. At this point, I am concerned. *****No bridge included with the violin.
customer_reviews.author: Chicken

customer_reviews.title: not bad. I was looking for a violin under $300 ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price I paid, not bad. I was looking for a violin under $300 but sounding like a $300 violin (which is my division point of tolerable or not.) This one has served fine and my violin student doesn't have any issues with it. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is simply because it matched but not exceed my expectations. But for a beginner instrument, this was a good choice and I'm glad I bought it to rent out to my student. She has had no trouble with it.
customer_reviews.author: NYC Violin Studio

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Beginner's Violin!
customer_reviews.text: Cremona is probably the best beginner violin brand because they care about quality. I've had this violin for 2 months now and it's still worth the price. The bow isn't really a high quality bow, but I don't think any beginner violin will have one. It's not a bad bow by any means, just don't expect a real fancy one. I bought this violin because it was highly recommended on a website as being the best beginner violin, and I can see why. I'm currently taking lessons and it sounds great. I recommend buying different rosin, because the kind this comes with is hard to use. Please don't buy some $30 piece of junk, it probably won't last a day.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Joyner

customer_reviews.title: She's seen some awful ones that fall apart or have poor sound. She's asked me where I got it ...
customer_reviews.text: My violin teacher keeps exclaiming that this is a high-quality beginner violin. She's seen some awful ones that fall apart or have poor sound. She's asked me where I got it and the price. She was shocked that it was only ~$170, from amazon and such high quality. Highly recommend for a beginner with 0-3 years of violin experience.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Awesome option for beginners & novice players
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this violin for my 12yr old's school music class versus renting from the local music shops. Decision to buy versus renting was mainly due to stringent application requirements and cost. This violin is perfect for school kids and beginners who are looking to familiarize themselves with string instruments for the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: Cremona 1/2
customer_reviews.text: This is the first Cremona we have ever purchased. Why spend a ton of money on a child's violin when it is only a matter of a year or so before you will have to purchase another because they have grown. This is a wonderful violin for the price. The bow was not the best, but that is an easy fix. In all honesty fiberglass bows are better for kids. Smaller violins don't always hold a tune so well, but his one is great. I love the case. It has straps so it can be worn backpack style. This is so worth the money and I would definitely purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Mcwethy

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: Beginner violinist here. Doesn't come with all the things in the photo, (like the shoulder rest and the dvd video). I still love it. Beautiful piece and after we finally figured out how to tune it, it makes a lovely sound. It is very lightweight and the case is nice. We will be enjoying this for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Myda C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my middle school student
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in perfect condition, beautiful shimmery black. The pegs hold well. I would recommend getting a better rosin, But that is a $3 fix on Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Lara T

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for 5 year old
customer_reviews.text: We are happy with this violin that we purchased for my 5 year daughter who is just starting violin lessons. we don't know how long she'll be interested in violin, so we didn't want to spend a lot of money but we wanted a decent instrument. The bow arrived broken, but amazon sent a replacement shipment in two days. The violin instructor seems to be satisfied that its worthy violin. My wife put it together and tuned it up and it seems to be working just fine. I believe this is the right size for a five year old, but I was kinda shocked at how tiny it was when it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a very good instrument
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this violin for my son, who is in 6th grade. His teacher was reluctant about "on-line" violins, but she was pleasantly surprised with the quality of this instrument. The violin was easy to set-up and has stayed in tune throughout the school year. After nine months of daily use, it is holding up very well. It has made it back and forth to school almost daily, and to several concerts and recitals. The sound is clear and crisp, and all parts have proven to be of good quality. No complaints here! For the price, this is a great starter instrument!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and affordable
customer_reviews.text: I decided to wait a while to let my son try it out before reviewing. After months of researching for a quality violin for my 11 yr old son, I found this on Amazon and brought it instantly. I had a few worries about how it would tune and how he would enjoy playing it. After playing for a few hours, he instantly fell in love with it. He even says that its better than the old instrument that we had been renting. I would recommend this violin to any one that needs a 1/2 size.
customer_reviews.author: AugustZ

customer_reviews.title: Could be a lot worse!
customer_reviews.text: It's playable, but I outgrew it in less than 3 months, so it'd be even less for someone more dedicated to practicing. Renting from a local shop (where I'm now renting-to-own an upgrade from Basic) is a much better choice, as is a vendor that curates the selection in a more opinionated way.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for a 1/8 violin
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this exact violin in 2012 for my older daughter to use. I read to never purchase a violin online since it typically doesn't have the same sound or quality as one that you buy or rent in a music store. I decided to go ahead and try this violin out since it had good reviews. Her violin teacher at that time said it looked great and sounded good for a 1/8 violin. Now, my younger daughter who is now 5 is using it. Her new violin teacher said the same about the violin. I feel like it was worth the purchase to not have to rent or purchase a more expensive violin.
customer_reviews.author: K. Davis

customer_reviews.title: good violin.
customer_reviews.text: After read a lot of review and shop around ..this violin has a lot of good review . And i kind like doubtful in my mind since my daughter's violin teacher said nothing would come out good from online order !! but i like to give it a try any way ...What a SURPRICE !!! after he tune it and play with it..He said it was good !! the sound come out good for a small price....I am lad I order it.......
customer_reviews.author: N. Manejit

customer_reviews.title: My daughter's teacher said this is a good enough quality violin for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: My daughter's teacher said this is a good enough quality violin for a beginner. I give it 4 stars because the first violin arrived with a bad bow and a bad G string. I asked Amazon to replace those 2 pieces only but they sent an entire violin. Everything worked well with the second one, so we returned the first. We've had a bit of trouble keeping it in tune so far, hoping that will get better. In the end, I think I would have been happier if I had just paid slightly more at my local music store. But it beats renting.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for $130...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. I watched a video on youtube on how to align the bridge. The strings are crap, so plan on buying a decent set. The tailpiece is made of plastic, but seems sturdy enough. I have played guitar for 5 years, so I am used to high action. The action of the strings was not bad at all, and was easy to play. The tuning pegs stay in place, I pushed them in until they were nice and snug. Plan on purchasing a "shoulder rest". I find it more comfortable. Other than that, seems like it was worth the money, for a beginner. I will give an update in a month or so. Hopefully everything works out.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Kurtz

customer_reviews.title: A good violin for learners
customer_reviews.text: A good violin for learners. My son is using it for over an year and not an issue. Better than those rentals
customer_reviews.author: Cheenu

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginner
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 5th grader who's prior violin would not stay in tune. Had bought a Cremona for my older daughter previously, and both girls as well as their music teachers are very happy with these violins.
customer_reviews.author: savvydoc

customer_reviews.title: Ok, better off spending a little more.
customer_reviews.text: Ok for the price. Purchased better strings but still goes out of tune quick.
customer_reviews.author: geo

customer_reviews.title: Here's a simple review - My daughter is extremely happy with this violin and her teacher says it perfect ...
customer_reviews.text: Here's a simple review - My daughter is extremely happy with this violin and her teacher says it perfect for her. My little girl is now 13 years old and been playing the violin since she was 3 years old. Her motivators [...]
customer_reviews.author: Ramon Dros

customer_reviews.title: Great student violin for the price
customer_reviews.text: My daughter had the 1/4 size of this model, so I was pleasantly surprised when the tone of the 1/2 was nicer. The outfit comes with all you need-violin, bow, case, and rosin. The only drawback was the bridge was not in place(on purpose) to prevent damage. Some customers would need a professional to set it correctly, however I have enough knowledge to be able to do it myself. I think this is a good violin for a growing violinist.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Wasnesky

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginner
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably priced and although not great sounding, it is good enough for beginners. So yes I would recommend it to beginners before you buy a better quality violin after some progression. Came with its own carrying case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality for grade school kids
customer_reviews.text: This instrument has a sound quality that matches that of the school provided violins. It is hard to get a decent sound with painted violins but this one delivers it!
customer_reviews.author: Kuzal

customer_reviews.title: ... has a warm tone but the bow has a bad quality, The bow hair fell off after a ...
customer_reviews.text: The violin has a warm tone but the bow has a bad quality, The bow hair fell off after a month use and is getting worse every day, every moment. It falls when putting on the rosin, when you loosen it after use, tight it up before using. I will consider if buy again when we look at the higher level violins.
customer_reviews.author: Y.C George

customer_reviews.title: Nice Sounding and Affordable
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my 7 year old son. His violin teacher said it was a good violin for a beginner. There are many more expensive options but also many cheap options. So I thought this was a good in-between. The only thing about it we didn't like was the bow was broken and his teacher said poorly made. So we did have to buy him another bow, but other than that, we have liked the violin.
customer_reviews.author: Christie

customer_reviews.title: Very nice Violin!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this brand for my son after I did tons of research to find a good one but with nice tone and durable. His teacher likes it! This is my son first violin. He loves to use it so far . I don't know much about Violin but I think it's good for beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Billie

customer_reviews.title: His music teacher says its a good beginner violin
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 11 year old son for music class . Was cheaper to buy one then to rent one . His music teacher says its a good beginner violin . Nice case also .
customer_reviews.author: chameleon

customer_reviews.title: Christmas present
customer_reviews.text: bought this for our daughter for Christmas. When she had her first lesson with the teacher she told her what a nice violin it was. And was surprised it had the metal fine tuners we were worried as we looked at all kinds of violins this was are first one and we compared ones from under 100 to over 500.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Will not hold tune even after new strings and professional tune. Unplayable
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has yet to be able to play this violin. She has been playing a rented violin for about a year so she knows how to play. On arrival, we could not get this one to tune properly. We took it in and had it professionally tuned. Two days later a string snapped. Not totally unheard of, bought new strings and attempted to tune. It will not hold a tune. The "E" string pulls back at the peg every time it is tuned not even coming close to the correct tone. The pegs do not go into their slots all the way. Honestly, it is just horrible. Do not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: It's a really nice violin for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son's violin lessons based off of his instructor's recommendations. It's a really nice violin for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Great Violin for the price
customer_reviews.text: This violin came intact and assembled and appears to be well constructed. Decent case, but what I like is the violin has a great sound, even for it's small size. It is also easy to tune and holds it's tune. I would recommend this violin for any young student progressing through their lessons.
customer_reviews.author: D.  Sparky

customer_reviews.title: For the price this is a great beginner buy
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a great beginner buy. If you've decided you like violin and want to continue past 6 months, I would immediately upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: The violin is nice, the case came damaged and with broken supports ...
customer_reviews.text: The violin is nice, the case came damaged and with broken supports inside. It was a Christmas gift for my college student child, so I had to try to repair the case.
customer_reviews.author: steve martin

customer_reviews.title: It's really beautiful - and I believe the sounds is quality though ...
customer_reviews.text: It's really beautiful - and I believe the sounds is quality though I'm a new violinist. I think for the price it's well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle

customer_reviews.title: Great Entry level violin for my son's 4th grade music ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Entry level violin for my son's 4th grade music class. Looks and feels like good quality. Hopefully he will continue playing for awhile!
customer_reviews.author: cc

customer_reviews.title: Excellent student or hobbyist violin
customer_reviews.text: Bought for niece and could not believe they can sell a complete package of this quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: manwithcash

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: It's sounds very good! I was really surprised.my 3year old grandson is delighted and so is my son
customer_reviews.author: Aida Lopez

customer_reviews.title: My daughter and her violin teacher love it so far
customer_reviews.text: My daughter and her violin teacher love it so far! She been using 1/2 size for 2.5 years now it is time to up size. I wouldn't say it is a perfect one but it meets our need at this time. The one thing that I don't like there is only one bow. We got to careful with it. Overall, it is a good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amie

customer_reviews.title: happy customer
customer_reviews.text: received it quickly; beautiful instrument; easy to assemble bridge; customer service at Austin Bazaar responded quickly to my request for a protective cover (which surprisingly was omitted from the shipment)
customer_reviews.author: NYer

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner violin!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice violin, great sound. Quality bow and instrument. We bought this as a beginner violin for our 6 yr old daughter and have been really happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Utah Reader

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: The bridge was missing upon delivery and the bow broke soon after my son started taking lessons.
customer_reviews.author: E. Davis

customer_reviews.title: ... seem to tune very well and doesn't have the best tone. Wish I had heard it before we ...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't seem to tune very well and doesn't have the best tone. Wish I had heard it before we bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's okay for what it is, although the sound ...
customer_reviews.text: It's okay for what it is, although the sound post isn't center, it's kind of off to the side, which I think is compromising the sound of my lower notes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really like this violin. I think it is a good value on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: David M

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice violin. Great value. I've used it for almost a year now on a weekly basis.
customer_reviews.author: SY

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves it
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loved her violin. All is needed, is to carry to get tuned
customer_reviews.author: GlammaGirl

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 5 year old. Her teacher recommended this brand and so far it's working well
customer_reviews.author: Danielle R

customer_reviews.title: i like it!
customer_reviews.text: very nice beginner violin for this kind of price. it came strung with the strings and bridge in place. however it was improperly strung so the string kept loosening from the pegs. the rosin is of cheap quality so i recommend buying a higher quality rosin.
customer_reviews.author: Panhia Xiong

customer_reviews.title: It's a great instrument
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my little cousin. She's was awesome at it, but then decided to become a trumpet player. It's a great instrument though, with good sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: AABRAH

customer_reviews.title: It is a beautiful instrument. Perfect for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: Received this as a gift from my husband. It is a beautiful instrument. Perfect for a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: John Perroni III

customer_reviews.title: very nice. Just what I needed for my daugther to ...
customer_reviews.text: very nice. Just what I needed for my daugther to start taking lessons.
customer_reviews.author: Lasado

customer_reviews.title: ... this and his music teacher said he has the best sounding violin out of all of his students
customer_reviews.text: My son plays this and his music teacher said he has the best sounding violin out of all of his students. Very happy with this beginner instrument.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Asked for a replacement and this one is very good. Solid and good quality
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd violin we got from the seller. The first one couldn't hold the tune. Asked for a replacement and this one is very good. Solid and good quality.
customer_reviews.author: A. Chang

customer_reviews.title: Great violin
customer_reviews.text: Violin has very full sound. Shipping was easy. Pleased with everything.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Great violin.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the violin. It is excellent quality and the price was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Racso

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase for the price. Has a decent sound for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: jawah

customer_reviews.title: Great Starter
customer_reviews.text: My daughter started out on this (7 years old) and has played it for over a year and a half. It seems cheaply made but will surprise you on how well it holds up for a beginners violin. She has now played this for a year and a half the the first string finally broke (easy fix). The bow has help up great as well. Perfect for a child that isn't sure if he/she wants to play the violin.
customer_reviews.author: M A Mc

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: First violin I've purchased since taking lessons. This product refuses to hold a tune.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective Goods
customer_reviews.text: The violin that arrived had a buzzing sound. I was explained, by my son's teacher, that "the nut is too low causing the action of the string to not work properly". Compared to his other violin -- it seems to be a bit higher. Took it to a local repair store -- they confirmed it. Tried to exchange for the new one, but was not available anymore. I guess return is the only option. I would not give it one star since it is not in working condition, but it could not go through without it
customer_reviews.author: slawekzuk

customer_reviews.title: Best Violin!
customer_reviews.text: It has a rich sound, even from the start! This is one of the best violins that you can buy from Amazon right now. I recommend any violinists to buy this violin and test it out.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wang

customer_reviews.title: Great intermediate violin
customer_reviews.text: The bridge was shaped a little funny And at first we thought we were gonna have to replace the strings (per teacher's request), but the strings have turned out okay. Violin is great for my 5 year old who has been playing nine months.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gannon

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good violin so far but it tends to get out of tune sometimes
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Product
customer_reviews.text: I don't know anything about music, but my daughter is taking violin in school and this worked out nicely. It had everything she needed and it was cheaper than renting.
customer_reviews.author: M. L. Maloney

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really nice for second hand. Everything was in place and shipment was quick
customer_reviews.author: Jovanna

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: wonderful instrument and came with the case - a bargain
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Violin / Very Good Quality...saved a lot over local price
customer_reviews.text: This same Violin local was $65 more + tax. It's a great violin - working out very well so far...happy with purchase. Owned for over 3 months now.
customer_reviews.author: GatorMan

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful sound and super quality
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely lovely. As a former violin player, my son is eager to learn, too. His teacher loves this violin. Easy to tune, easy to set up with a great carrying case. We purchased one prior to this purchase off of ebay with tragic results!!! This one by far receives an a+ and the service was outstanding!! This is more practical and we get to keep it rather than paying monthly rental fees for a violin from a local instrument shop. His teacher loves it....we can't wait to make some music with it.
customer_reviews.author: John's Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Good Violin
customer_reviews.text: I bought this violin to teach my 7 yr old son and so far I am quite satisfied with the quality. The looks of this violin is quite impressive and sound quality is excellent considering that this is an entry level model. It comes in a nice box, easy to carry around with 1 bow and rosin.
customer_reviews.author: Amazoner

customer_reviews.title: nice one
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my 6 and half year old son to replace his 1/8 violin. his teacher says it is nice one with nice sound. I just wish it would come with two bows.
customer_reviews.author: H. Gao

customer_reviews.title: Overrated
customer_reviews.text: Simply an overrated violin! I took it to a professional violinist from over 30 years and she said the neck wasn't very shapely. After perfectly fine tuning the instrument, it still sounded bad (harsh). I suppose all it would take is replacement strings but all in all, there are better violins at this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Prasad

customer_reviews.title: Bad bridge!
customer_reviews.text: I am an experienced player teaching my children, and the 1/16 I bought is almost good. I had good sound on most strings, however the D string could not be played without hitting the A and G as well, meaning the bridge curve is wrong. To fix this would mean an expense not worth the cost, so I am likely returning it for a higher quality violin. It takes more work to get the smaller violins to sound decent.
customer_reviews.author: Famlife

customer_reviews.title: Son's Birthday present
customer_reviews.text: So far seems to be perfect for a beginner. He's started playing it a bit, but looking for a teacher locally.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Great Violin for the price !
customer_reviews.text: We bought it for my 9yr old daughter last year. It's working great and didn't have any problems with it. Really a wonderful violin for the price !
customer_reviews.author: rpv

customer_reviews.title: twice buyer, twice pleased!
customer_reviews.text: these violins are nicer than the more expensive ones in the store. and, as usual, Amazon delivers in super fast shipping as well as solid packaging.
customer_reviews.author: yetipogi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent purchase. Great value. Working out great for my 9yr old.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: better rosin, a tuner
customer_reviews.text: Bow was broken when received. Of course im buying a new one anyway. Its a beauty of a violin and i cant wait to get a new chin rest, shoulder rest, a new bow, better rosin, a tuner, and new strings :) then I will be set. Good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: MDS

customer_reviews.title: Nice Violin.
customer_reviews.text: Great little violin for the money. My 7 year old grandson is learning to play quite nicely from this violin which is very good for a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Joni

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: You get the violin, bow, rosin, and the case. I would have given 5 stars but one of the horse hairs on the bow was caught in the bow lock so I had to cut it off. Be aware that you might have to buy another bow when you get this package because I've seen ones where all the hairs were messed up. It's a very good violin for beginners like me but I would recommend getting one of higher quality if you're an intermediate to expert player.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional violin and service; outstanding product.
customer_reviews.text: We just received the violin via Fed Ex and it was packaged very well. The case is very nice, but when opened, it reveals a magnificent violin and bow; outstanding workmanship, not only on the instrument, but the inside of the case, as well. The bridge was wrapped very carefully and we also noticed that the case provides a spot for the bow to be secured, which is wonderful. We had no idea that a violin in this price range could be this extraordinary. I even sent the seller a well earned Thank You prior to typing this message.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Nice entry level violin.
customer_reviews.text: Great 1st Violin. We bought a cheaper model first that couldn't be tuned. Parents learn from our mistakes...don't go too cheap or the instrument is almost useless.
customer_reviews.author: W. Littlejohn

customer_reviews.title: beautiful Violin
customer_reviews.text: This violin was exactly as specified in the description. With a little tuning, I'm able to play. I'm new to learning the violin, but loved how the instrument looked when it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Leadbetter

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an upgrade for my kid from size 1/4 to 1/2. Although,it seems to be a little pricier than other brands,i found mostly positive reviews about this product.My kids music teacher also mentioned that its a good violin. Happy with my purchase !
customer_reviews.author: Techgeek

customer_reviews.title: Very nice Violin!
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a very good violin. Very nice sound to it, it has great playability and it is perfect for a first time student. It seem very well made and has endured the hand of my seven year old. Had to replace the arch because it broke, but it was an accident, so does not affect my love for this violin. I would recommend buying one or two additional arches up front. Overall very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rob B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Price Great Violin
customer_reviews.text: We used this violin for my 9 year old to start violin lessons. It has been a great quality for a beginner. Have not had any problems besides normal wear and tear. It came with a great carrying case and the rosin! Ready to go! Just watch in the packaging, the bridge comes disassembled and must be inserted before use.
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: Cremona SV-130 Violin
customer_reviews.text: Excellent starter violin. Made well, great case and easy for my 9 year old to use. I was very impressed with the owrkmanship and sound and I am a professional musician of 35 years. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: PF

customer_reviews.title: Returned to Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this violin would not stay in tune. The pegs would not stay tight after being tuned. It was not well built.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Maryan

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: We bought this violin for our daughter in 3 rd grade. It arrived promptly and in good shape with a nice padded hard cover. She has started her lessons and we have not had any complaints. It is much cheaper than renting. We are extremely satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Philip George

customer_reviews.title: broken bow in one month
customer_reviews.text: Violin itself is good, but not the bow and strings. The strings work and makes an okay sound, but not the best quality. The bow's silver thing that connects with the frog isn't glued tight, and when my son was playing, the bow started to crack in the middle. For $100, I would say this is an okay package for beginners. You just have to buy better strings if you want and maybe get a new bow.
customer_reviews.author: Beibei999

customer_reviews.title: But...
customer_reviews.text: Its good, but even if you tune it, it doesnt sound right.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: ... of the little imperfections that Chinese don't give a crap
customer_reviews.text: it was I got five stars if it was made in America but there's a little imperfections on it obviously because it's made in China where they don't really do that well we're thinking about not keeping it we're not sure because of the little imperfections that Chinese don't give a crap about
customer_reviews.author: Tex

product_meta.title: Cremona SV-130 Premier Novice Violin Outfit - 4/4 Size,Traditional Brown
product_meta.description: Style:Violin| Size:4/4| Color:Traditional BrownSV-130 Violin Outfit 4/4 Size. Saga has always been a pioneer when it comes to making quality violins to meet the demands of the growing student market. While focusing primarily on quality and value to meet a specific price point, the new SV-130 Cremona Premier Novice Series violin was developed. It is important for a student to get fast results with a first instrument. In order for that to happen, the string height and tension has to be such that it is not painful to play, and likewise, the body has to be sufficiently resonant that it produces a rich and satisfying tone. The Cremona SV-130 satisfies both of these requirements. Whether the student is in the earliest stages of the learning process, or well on the way to more advanced training, these violins will perform well beyond the expectation. Now ships with high quality D'Addario Prelude strings. Includes bow and plush-lined case. Available in 1/4 through 4/4 sizes (select from dropdown menu).
feature_bullets: Properly fitted Swiss-style ebony pegs and quality lightweight composite tailpiece with 4 smooth fine tuners for easy tuning
Correct string height and string spacing for accurate finger positioning and intonation
Cremona's top selling novice violin for more than 10 years; check out the new video
Every Cremona student violin comes with US-made Prelude strings; the educator's preferred strings for students
Low profile Kaufman-style chinrest; oiled neck for better feel and well balanced bow for ease of playing
Ebony fittings; ebony fingerboard; hand carved solid spruce and solid maple body; lightweight construction means quality workmanship
To learn more about the fantastic features of this product; see Product Description below
